alert.note: Alert for Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 11:43PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washburn and southwestern Sawyer Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1142 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Birchwood, or 15 miles northeast of Rice Lake, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Radisson and Couderay around 1200 AM CDT. New Post and Chief Lake on Chippewa Flowage around 1205 AM CDT. Chippewa Flowage West around 1210 AM CDT. Chippewa Flowage East around 1215 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Reserve, Chief Lake, Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation, Edgewater, Little Sissabagama Lake, Deer Lake, Chippewa Lake, Ojibwa, Angus and Sissabagama Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
